contentrichtext.text: '''Shenandoah''' is a word of [[Iroquoian]] origin, derived from the word '[[deer]]'.<ref>{{cite book|last=Bright|first=William|title=Native American Placenames of the United States|year=2004|publisher=University of Oklahoma Press|location=Norman, Oklahoma|isbn=0-8061-3576-X|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=5XfxzCm1qa4C&lpg=PP1&pg=PA437#v=onepage&q&f=false|authorlink=William Bright|accessdate=2012-10-24|page=437}}</ref> '''Shenandoah''' may also refer to the following: ==Places== ===United States=== ;Virginia and West Virginia *[[Shenandoah, Virginia]], a town in the state of Virginia *[[Shenandoah County, Virginia]], a county in the state of Virginia *[[Shenandoah River]], a river in Virginia and West Virginia *[[Shenandoah Valley]], the valley through which that river runs *[[Shenandoah Valley AVA]], an American Viticultural Area in Virginia and West Virginia *[[Shenandoah Mountain]], a mountain in Virginia and West Virginia *[[Shenandoah National Park]], a national park east of the Shenandoah Valley ;Other US places *[[Shenandoah (Miami)|Shenandoah, Miami, Florida]], a neighborhood within the City of Miami, Florida. *[[Shenandoah, Iowa]] *[[Shenandoah, Louisiana]] *[[Shenandoah, New York]] *[[Shenandoah, Pennsylvania]] *[[Shenandoah, Texas]] *[[Shenandoah, Houston, Texas]], neighborhood of Houston, Texas *[[Shenandoah Creek]], a tributary of Mahanoy Creek in Pennsylvania *[[California Shenandoah Valley AVA]], an American Viticultural Area in California ===New Zealand=== *[[Shenandoah River, New Zealand]], a river in South Island *[[Shenandoah Highway]] or State Highway 65, in South Island ==Transportation== ;Ships * {{USS|Shenandoah}}, several ships * USNS ''Shenandoah'' (T-AO-181), an oiler laid down in 1964, renamed {{USNS|Potomac|T-AO-181}} * {{Ship|CSS|Shenandoah}}, a Confederate Navy screw steamer * [[Shenandoah (schooner)|''Shenandoah'' (schooner)]], a 1964 topsail-schooner run by The Black Dog * {{F/V Shenandoah}}, purse seine fishing vessel built in 1925 at the Skansie Brothers Shipyard in Gig Harbor, Washington. Now on display at the Harbor History Museum in Gig Harbor. ;Airship *{{USS|Shenandoah|ZR-1}}, an American naval rigid airship, broken up in a storm in 1925 ;Trains *[[Shenandoah (B&O)|''Shenandoah'' (B&O)]], an American passenger train *[[Shenandoah (Amtrak)|''Shenandoah'' (Amtrak)]], an American passenger train between Washington, DC and Cincinnati, Ohio ==Arts and media== *"[[Oh Shenandoah]]", a popular American folk song or sea shanty *"Shenandoah", a song by New Zealand folk singer Bill Morris. * "[[Wreck of the Shenandoah]]" a song recorded by Vernon Dalhart *[[Shenandoah (film)|''Shenandoah'' (film)]], a 1965 movie starring Jimmy Stewart *[[Shenandoah (musical)|''Shenandoah'' (musical)]], a 1974 Broadway musical based on the movie *[[Shenandoah (band)]], a country music group :*[[Shenandoah (album)|''Shenandoah'' (album)]], their 1987 self-titled debut album *Shenandoah, a band formed by [[Arlo Guthrie]] *[[Shenandoah (magazine)|''Shenandoah'' (magazine)]], a literary magazine published by Washington and Lee University *''[[A Man Called Shenandoah]]'', a Western television series ==People== *[[Joanne Shenandoah]], an [[Iroquois]] singer and acoustic guitarist ==Institutions== *[[Shenandoah Valley Academy]], a parochial, college preparatory boarding school in New Market, Virginia *[[Army of the Shenandoah (Confederate)]], a Confederate army during the American Civil War *[[Army of the Shenandoah (Union)]], a Union army during the American Civil War *[[Shenandoah University]], a university in Winchester, Virginia *[[Museum of the Shenandoah Valley]], also in Winchester, Virginia ==Other== *[[Shenandoah (beard)]], a type of beard *[[Shenandoah-Dives Mill]], a former ore mill *[[Summit_Point_Motorsports_Park#Shenandoah_Circuit|Shenandoah Circuit]], a race track at [[Summit Point Motorsports Park]], West Virginia * "[[Oh Shenandoah]]", an American [[folk song]] ==References== <references /> ==See also== *{{lookfrom|Shenandoah}} {{disambiguation}} [[Category:Place name disambiguation pages]]
